chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
R: stack sig
a: sig
x: list sig

Goal:
rewt G [S] x -> count x S <= 1

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
G = (S, (S, [S]) :: map (fun '(u, v) => (S, u ++ [S] ++ v)) R ++ map (fun '(u, v) => (S, u ++ [a] ++ v)) R) : sig * list (sig * list sig)
Inductive rewt (S : cfg) (x : list sig) : list sig -> Prop := rewtRefl : rewt S x x | rewtRule : forall y z : list sig, rewt S x y -> rew_cfg S y z -> rewt S x z Arguments rewt _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments rewtRefl _ _%list_scope Arguments rewtRule _ (_ _ _)%list_scope
stack = fun X : Type => list (card X) : Type -> Type Arguments stack _%type_scope
count = fix count (l : list sig) (n : sig) {struct l} : sig := match l with | [] => 0 | m :: l0 => if n =? m then Datatypes.S (count l0 n) else count l0 n end : list sig -> sig -> sig Arguments count _%list_scope _%nat_scope
S = fresh Sigma : sig
rewtRule : forall (S : cfg) (x y z : list sig), rewt S x y -> rew_cfg S y z -> rewt S x z
rewt_ind : forall (S : cfg) (x : list sig) (P : list sig -> Prop), P x -> (forall y z : list sig, rewt S x y -> P y -> rew_cfg S y z -> P z) -> forall l : list sig, rewt S x l -> P l
rewt_sind : forall (S : cfg) (x : list sig) (P : list sig -> SProp), P x -> (forall y z : list sig, rewt S x y -> P y -> rew_cfg S y z -> P z) -> forall l : list sig, rewt S x l -> P l
L = fun (G : cfg) (x : list sig) => rewt G [startsym G] x /\ terminal G x : cfg -> list sig -> Prop Arguments L _ _%list_scope
sym_G_rewt : forall (x : list sig) (G : cfg) (y : list sig), x <<= sym_G G -> rewt G x y -> y <<= sym_G G
rewtRefl : forall (S : cfg) (x : list sig), rewt S x x
countSplit : forall (A B : list sig) (x : sig), count A x + count B x = count (A ++ B) x
terminal = fun (G : cfg) (x : list sig) => ~ (exists y : list sig, rew_cfg G x y) : cfg -> list sig -> Prop Arguments terminal _ _%list_scope
notInZero : forall (x : sig) (A : list sig), ~ x el A < -> count A x = 0
terminal_iff_G : forall y : list sig, terminal G y < -> ~ S el y
sym = fix sym (R : stack sig) : list sig := match R with | [] => [] | (x, y) :: R0 => x ++ y ++ sym R0 end : stack sig -> list sig
startsym = fun G : cfg => fst G : cfg -> sig
itau1_app : forall A B : list sig, itau1 ?P (A ++ B) = itau1 ?P A ++ itau1 ?P B where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type] ?P : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- stack ?X]
itau2_app : forall A B : list sig, itau2 ?P (A ++ B) = itau2 ?P A ++ itau2 ?P B where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type] ?P : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- stack ?X]
sym_G = fun G : cfg => startsym G :: flat_map (fun '(a, x) => a :: x) (rules G) : cfg -> list sig
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack sig, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card sig * stack sig -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : sig | S : sig -> sig Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
tau2_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau2 (A ++ B) = tau2 A ++ tau2 B where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type]
tau1_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau1 (A ++ B) = tau1 A ++ tau1 B where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type]
rules = fun G : cfg => snd G : cfg -> list rule
nil_app_nil : forall A : list ?X, A = [] ++ A ++ [] where ?X : [R : stack sig a : sig x : list sig |- Type]
gamma = fun A : stack sig => map (fun '(x, y) => (x, rev y)) A : stack sig -> list (list sig * list sig)
PCP = PCPX : stack sig -> Prop
Byte.to_nat_bounded : forall x : Byte.byte, Byte.to_nat x <= 255
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> sig
tau2_inv : forall (a : sig) (B : stack sig) (z : list sig), tau2 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list sig, (y, a :: x) el B
tau1_inv : forall (a : sig) (B : stack sig) (z : list sig), tau1 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list sig, (a :: x, y) el B
lt = fun n m : sig => Datatypes.S n <= m : sig -> sig -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
NoDup_count_occ : forall (A : Type) (decA : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A), NoDup l < -> (forall x : A, count_occ decA l x <= 1)
